name: The Continent
description: The Continent is a sprawling, war‑torn land of varied climates, from icy deserts of Skellige to misty forests of Velen. Kingdoms and city‑states vie for power while ancient monsters roam the countryside. Magic, politics, and folklore intertwine, shaping the lives of peasants and nobles alike. Travelers uncover ruins, battle beasts, and seek hidden treasure across its rugged terrain.

White Orchard.name: White Orchard
White Orchard.description: White Orchard is a quiet farming region bordering the swamps, dotted with small villages, fields, and ruined towers. Its landscape is marked by dense forests, misty waters, and wandering monsters. The population consists of humble farmers, woodcutters, and a few herbalists who tend the land. Travelers and witchers often pass through, seeking contracts and supplies.

Geralt of Rivia.name: Geralt of Rivia
Geralt of Rivia.description: Geralt is a tall, pale-skinned witcher with white hair and striking yellow eyes. He wears a weathered leather armor and a pair of twin steel swords at his hips. As a monster hunter, he travels the region to investigate recent monster attacks on the villagers. He seeks a cure for a deadly disease that has spread throughout White Orchard.

Royal Palace in Vizima.name: Royal Palace in Vizima
Royal Palace in Vizima.description: The Royal Palace in Vizima sits at the heart of the Northern Kingdom's capital, a grand stone fortress overlooking bustling streets. It serves as the seat of the king and queen, hosting nobles, courtiers, and royal guards. Around the palace, merchants, scholars, and artisans provide services to the city’s elite and common folk. The palace also houses diplomats and emissaries from distant lands.

Geralt of Rivia.name: Geralt of Rivia
Geralt of Rivia.description: Geralt stands tall, his white hair cropped short, pale skin marked by scars, and eyes hidden behind amber lenses. He is a Witcher, a monster hunter trained in combat and alchemy. He has entered the Royal Palace in Vizima to negotiate a contract with King Foltest and investigate rumors of a cursed creature lurking within the city.

Velen.name: Velen
Velen.description: Velen is a scarred, war‑torn region of endless marshes, abandoned farms, and ruined villages. Its soil is haunted by cursed spirits, and monsters roam the misty fields. Peasants eke out a living in tiny hamlets, while bandits, witches, and the mysterious Crones of Crookback Mountain prey on the weak. Scattered soldiers and traveling traders also pass through seeking refuge.

Geralt of Rivia.name: Geralt of Rivia
Geralt of Rivia.description: Geralt is a tall, pale-skinned witcher with white hair, a scarred face and striking yellow eyes. He wears battered leather armor and carries a steel sword for men and a silver sword for monsters. He works as a professional monster hunter for coin and contracts. He is in Velen to investigate a wave of curses striking the war‑torn villages and to find clues about Ciri's whereabouts. He also seeks a lucrative contract to slay a legendary wyvern terrorizing the countryside.

Novigrad.name: Novigrad
Novigrad.description: Novigrad is the largest free port city on the continent, a maze of crowded streets, towering spires, and busy docks. It is a hub of commerce, home to merchant guilds, craftsmen, and countless taverns. The city's inhabitants range from wealthy nobles and church officials of the Eternal Fire to thieves, alchemists, and common laborers. Magic users, scholars, and conspirators operate in its shadows.

Geralt of Rivia.name: Geralt of Rivia
Geralt of Rivia.description: Geralt stands tall, his white hair cropped short and his scarred, pale skin marked by the faint glow of mutant eyes. He wears a weathered leather coat over layered armor, twin steel swords sheathed at his hips, and a distinct silver pendant bearing the School of the Wolf. A Witcher by trade, he roams the bustling streets of Novigrad hunting monsters and investigating the political intrigue that threatens the city. He seeks the missing bard, a key witness to a conspiracy, while also looking for a rumored cure for a cursed child. His presence in the city blends contract work with a personal quest for answers.

The Skellige Isles.name: The Skellige Isles
The Skellige Isles.description: The Skellige Isles are a rugged archipelago of storm‑ battered cliffs, pine‑covered hills, and fishing villages. Clans of fierce warriors and sea‑savvy sailors dominate the islands, each led by a clan chief. The people are hardy fishermen, blacksmiths, and storytellers who honor ancient traditions and the sea gods. Druids and mystics also dwell in remote groves, guiding the islands’ spiritual life.

Geralt of Rivia.name: Geralt of Rivia
Geralt of Rivia.description: Geralt stands tall, his white hair cropped short, his scarred skin weathered by sea winds. He wears leather armor reinforced with steel plates, the Wolf medallion hanging at his chest. As a witcher, he hunts monsters and offers his services to the islanders. He has come to Skellige to investigate a surge of sea monsters threatening the fleet and to fulfill a contract from the Skellige chieftains.

Kaer Morhen.name: Kaer Morhen
Kaer Morhen.description: Kaer Morhen is an ancient mountain keep that serves as the Witchers’ stronghold and training ground. Its stone walls shelter a small community of veteran Witchers, apprentices, and caretakers who tend the forge and stables. The keep also houses a library of monster lore and occasional scholars studying the arts. Beyond its gates, the surrounding forests are home to wild beasts and wandering travelers.

Geralt of Rivia.name: Geralt of Rivia
Geralt of Rivia.description: Geralt stands tall, his white hair tied back, scarred skin and amber eyes hint at countless battles. He is a Witcher, a monster hunter trained at Kaer Morhen. He has returned to the fortress to train apprentices and investigate a new contract involving a mysterious creature.

start: I am Geralt of Rivia, a witcher of the School of the Wolf, scarred from countless hunts and driven by the promise of a cure for the disease haunting this land. I stand on the winding path outside the village of White Orchard, the late‑afternoon sun casting long shadows over the thatched roofs and the distant, crumbling tower. Around me, fields sway, woodcutters chat, and the forest beyond murmurs with unseen beasts that have begun to prey on the farmers.
